bibl.title: The Unexpected Guests: Patterns of Xenia in Callimachus' 'Victoria Berenices' and Petronius' Satyricon.
bibl.note: Petronius used Ovid and the Hecale overtly in his text. He was also familiar with the 'Victoria', and used it as a literary model. Callimachus provided Petronius with the perfect model of inversion.
bibl.seg: ROSENMEYER Patricia A., The Unexpected Guests: Patterns of Xenia in Callimachus' 'Victoria Berenices' and Petronius' Satyricon.
Petronius used Ovid and the Hecale overtly in his text. He was also familiar with the 'Victoria', and used it as a literary model. Callimachus provided Petronius with the perfect model of inversion.
